Paired with brown suede boots, this dress was a great option for our mild Charleston autumn. I did find the dress to be a tad large, so I could have sized down, but the tie at the waist kept that from being a problem.
This fits slightly large, but it wasn't an issue since the dress had a wrap waist!
The color was just such a nice pop of yellow. I added a belt because I thought it was a little loose.

I loved the pattern on this dress and the fabric is very nice and lightweight. However, it just was not flattering when I tried it on. The sleeves looked enormous and not in an oversized way - in an ill-fitted way. I tried with and without the belt but neither way looked great.

I loved the color, the fabric was nice and was so excited to try it on. I got a LRG and XL as a back up. I tried on the LRG and was so big a frumpy especially in the chest. I ordered the larger back up because I do have a larger chest and it is usually he reason I go a size up.

I'm 7 months pregnant and really wanted to get the Large; however, it was all out, so I got the Xl and boy oh boy - the dress runs large. If you have big ol' knockers this dress is PERFECT. Even though it was a size too big I got compliments all day long. It is a beautiful dress and light fabric.

It was the right color and weight and length for a late summer outdoor wedding. However XL (I'm 10/12) was FAR too big. I didn't have anything else to wear (note to self: try it on before you leave the house next time) so made it work with the help of some safety pins in the waist. Husband liked it so I guess there's that.
I want to own this shirt! I wore it several days on vacation. The cutest beach cover up!

These aren't my typical style but trying to branch out as I work from home! These fit great but do run long so I am wearing with heels. These jeans were so comfy - I had no issues wearing them all day at home
I'm not ready to send these bad boys back. These jeans are everything I have ever wanted in a pair of denim. So unique & comfy. Living my fashion dreams in these!!!!!!!
Cannot stress how much I loved these jeans. They may not be everyone's cup of tea but the fit is perfect and they are super comfortable. Make this into a whole look.

LOVED these pants! They're not too fitted that you can't breathe or move, but they offer the perfect high-waist to shape your body and lengthen your legs. Plus, the unique denim patchwork takes these from everyday jeans to showstoppers. If they didn't retail for over $500, I'd DEFINITELY have my own pair in my closet right now.
I wore these over the weekend to the beach and they were so comfortable and flattering
Loved how it felt very fit and also got baggy over a chunky shoe

Some reviewers said these ran big, others small. I'm with the runs smalls. These are very high waisted, I ordered my normal size and they were cutting into my ribs. I was hoping to wear them all day for an account meeting but there's no way I could get through an entire day in them. But they were perfect and cute for Sunday brunch with my husband. Love the details, not the fit.

links_reviews_title: Make all your boho chic dreams come true
links_reviews_text: If you've got long legs and want to look like a bougie boho Laurel Canyon daydream, then these are the jeans for you. I'm 5'9" and caught between a size 26 and 27; these are definitely on the larger side. If you're still not sure, trust me. Size up. Pair with a tiny tee, groovy boots, and your freshest daisy chain.
Super duper long. Need to wear with platforms for sure. I sized up like previous reviews had mentioned and I'm glad I did! So comfortable

links_reviews_title: Quality statement piece! LOOONG! Size down!!
links_reviews_text: These are definitely tall girl pants! I'm 5'8" and wore with stacked heel boots and length was perfect, just skimmed the floor. I'm usually size 27, rented the 26R and was comfortable, but could've sized down to 25! I like a tight fit pant, so that's up to preference. Definitely size down at least one size though! Very thick/heavy, quality denim material! Wore multiple times while rented. Crop sweater pictured is also from RTR (Nanushka).
Got so many compliments on these pants!! They are definitely true to size and fit like a glove.
These were not flattering which I expected but they were comfortable to wear. 11" rise and 32" inseam, didn't touch the ground for me.

links_reviews_title: So cute- but you gotta be TALL
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'2" & this was WAY too long for me, not even hem tape AND my tallest heels could save me. The pattern and cut of the waist however is super cute. Recommend if you're at least 5'7" and wear heels/wedges. Unfortunately I couldn't wear it out due to the length, but trying it on I loved it so much. Waist could be a tad snug after eating, but I liked the fit still.

links_reviews_title: These pants are dope but run big
links_reviews_text: I wore the 24R and needed a belt. Also I'm 5.6" and had to wear boots with a ~ 1.5" heel to keep them off the ground. Still, these pants are phenomenal. Definitely recommend if you're on the taller side! I would have bought them if they weren't $500.

I should have sized down to the 25. I tend to vary depending on the brand. These pants are beautiful and very high waisted. The pant legs are very long too. I had to wear 4 inch heels so the bottoms wouldn't drag (just barely)! I think the fit would have been better had I gone down one size. Bc they were a little large they kind of gave of the "mom jean" vibe, I mean, def a "cool mom" but still no one really wants a fupa.... either way, excellent quality; would rent again in. Fits to size-ish

SO CUTE BUT SIZE DOWN 2 sizes! I am 5'9 and usually wear a 27/28 but heard these ran large. I wore a 26 and they were still pretty big both in terms of waist and length and definitely stretched throughout the day. I wore 2.5" booties to give me a little more height which was a good idea. However, these pants were amazing and I got compliments all day and night. At end of the day I wished I had even rented a 25 or wore a belt because I had to keep pulling them up.
These were a fan favorite. Love love love length, fit and comfort. Highly Recommend
Created unflattering lines. May be better for curvier folks. Created an unflattering pouch on me. Possibly stretched by a previous wearer.

These pants run super long. I rented them for a 70's themed party and I thought I could pull them off with major platforms but I just couldn't make them work for me. I returned them without wearing them.
Heavy and large. Too big for me.

links_reviews_title: Made for 6 feet or more tall people
links_reviews_text: Fits awesome in waist and hip, but unless I wore stilts, I could not possibly wear these.

These were so funky fresh in a chic way. I would have definitely wore them if I wasn't borrowing or wore anything but flats because they were too long and I didn't want to fuck them up. I took one star off because I like my jeans to hug my bottom a little firmer but otherwise these are fabulous.
Great, fun jeans. Lots of compliments.

I LOVED these jeans. So comfy, so many ways to style them. I totally would've purchased them if they weren't so expensive. I'd recommend sizing down if you're looking for them to be more form fitting.
Unflattering on my curves and way too long.

These pants are crazyâ¦ I rented a small size due to the reviews that didn't fit and I rented it again two times larger size that also didn't fit. Extremely unflattering. Unless you're a size 0 and 5'10 don't try to rent this
I sized down like the reviews suggested and they fit perfect. So obsessed with these. Too expensive but happy I could wear by renting. Loved loved loveddd, lots of compliments too. Comfy!

Got compliments on these jeans wherever I wore them from random strangers. You definitely want to size down as suggested by others, but not necessarily 2 sizes. I am a pretty consistent 27 in jeans, with an occasional 28 and occasional 26 depending on brand. The 26 was perfect. There is a lot of fabric and they are very long, so might not work for a petite person (I'm 5'6"and needed high heels to keep them off the floor)
Made my legs look so long, but i'm 5'9 1/2 and they touched to floor on me! Also, size 1 or 2 down bc they run very big. Other than that they fit perfectly and i love them and want to marry them.

Total flower child vibe. Wore it with pink four shirt and one inch booties since the legs are a bit long. I would totally wear this with a less extravagant top to brunch! Also the denim is rigid but still pretty comfortable!

I read the other reviews on this awesome pair of jeans, and I went with everyone when they advised to size down. I got a size 29... Well, I can say if you have an ample amount of derriere, and hips do not size down. Go with your regular size you wear. The length and style of these jeans are perfection, I didn't get to wear them due to not being able to button them! I may rent again in the correct size. They're worth it!

links_reviews_title: cute but NOT made for short girls
links_reviews_text: so cute! loved the design, but so long that they reached the floor even when i was wearing heels. i'm 5' 4", so i'm on the shorter side and not too surprised. still think they're gorgeous !
I'm normally a 26/27 but should have definitely ordered a 25. They ran large at the waist
These run really long, I am 5'5 and I needed to be 5' 10 to wear these. Other than my being too short, a great pair of jeans.

I was really excited for these, but didn't end up wearing them. There were just a few too many flaws that made their fit look sloppy. First, they are way too long. I'm 5'8", and even with 2+ inch heels I would have needed to keep them pulled up as high as I can and cuff the bottoms up another 2 or more inches. Also, there are two stripes up the side of each leg. One stripe goes all the way up to the waistline. But the side stripe closer to the front cuts off at the bottom of the pockets, which eliminates any slimming effect that a stripe might otherwise have and creates the illusion that the pockets are puffing out and wider than the hips. The wash of the pockets is also significantly darker than the surrounding denim's wash, which draws more attention to the big belly effect. Aside from the length and unflattering belly area, they fit as I'd expected.

links_reviews_title: So bummed these were too long!
links_reviews_text: These fit perfectly at the waist but we're SO LONG! I'm about 5'4" and even when wearing 4 inch heels the hem of the jeans were still dragging on the floor. I'm so bummed because I was so excited to wear these.

other reviews mentioned it being short in torso, I thought I'd be fine since I'm petite/shirt. normal size did fit, but could tell torso was short/snug. However, after a few minutes and moving, it really wasn't noticeable. Sizing up helped the torso but was much too large in bust. I did need help with zipper for restroom. I wore it to a resturant/dinner party so wasn't a deal breaker for me. Comfortable, trendy, love the colors. Not a heavy fabric.
Fits true to size. Comfortable, cute, can be dressed up or down. And it has pockets which you can actually put things in without it being visible - big win! Felt great in this jumpsuit.
Colors are beautiful. The fabric in the shoulders was a little thought for my build, but I still loved the piece.
Easy jumpsuit to wear and it has pockets :)

links_reviews_title: Roomie, float, easy breezy. Great for year-round
links_reviews_text: I rented this for a fall Friendsgiving, and also wore to work. I styled it with different boots and it was great as a fall look, but this works great in the spring as well. The material is very light! Great colors! I am typically a 2 or 4, and the size small was a bit big on me. I wound up tying the waist tie front and back to provide more definition
Fits perfect! I think this is best for someone short (I'm 5'1) because the torso is short. Would be tight on someone with a long torso. I love this piece!
For a petite woman with small boobs, it is not a very flattering fit.
Too low cut
It's very cute and comfortable, but I have long legs and a short torso so it was definitely not cut for me. The inseam would pull upward to places it shouldn't be.
Square- one pro is that Ive got long proportions, and the torso actually fit. I did not end up wearing it for anything because it looked like a potato sack with a bow.

links_reviews_title: Couldn't zip it all the way up
links_reviews_text: Maybe my arms are too big or my shoulders too broad for this brand but the sleeves were so restrictive that I wasn't able to zip it all the way by myself which would have made going to the bathroom a real challenge. The fabric was beautiful and the rest of the jumpsuit fit like a glove. Oh well :(

links_reviews_title: Liked it so much, I kept it!
links_reviews_text: At 5'0, I always worry about length with items like this. However, this jumpsuit was perfect & still a little cropped, even for someone as short as me. The v- neck dipped a little low on me, so I did have to adjust the top from time to time, but it wasn't distracting. I like it so much I decided to keep it!
Thin material, runs small.
so easy to wear

links_reviews_title: It fit PERFECTLY. I was able to wear it to 3 separate events, and 3 separate looks.
links_reviews_text: The fit was SPOT ON. I am 5'4" 140, and athletic build- more curvy on bottom, small waist and 34D breast size. It fit like a glove. I thought it was tasteful and elegant in all of my looks. The length is good for someone who is shorter. I can't wait to get this again!!!
i'm typically a small, but this worked well in an XS. because i'm short still fell at a weird length so looked better with a wedge. cute pattern, easy to wear, wld recommend
This jumpsuit got the job done. It was cute but a little strange in the busy area (very loose).

links_reviews_title: A little short in the torso but otherwise great jumpsuit!
links_reviews_text: Great pattern and generally good fit. It ran a bit short in the torso so I couldn't really lift my arms. Also, the liner is not the full length of the pant so it tends to ride up when sitting.

This piece is REALLY short in the torso as stated before in other reviews. I have a short torso and thought it would be ok, but I still felt like it wasn't quite right. The arms were also hard to raise which made zipping it up difficult.

This jumpsuit was fun to wear to work. The fit was true to size and fairly relaxed. I have rented this in the blue color and enjoyed it, but this color combo is even prettier. I would also rent this for a weekend outing as well.

links_reviews_title: Great casual jumpsuit! Just a TINY bit short
links_reviews_text: I loved everything about this jumpsuit material, colors, fit (almost)! I have a very long torso and am 5'10 so jumpsuits don't normally work for me this was about an inch too short in the torso so I am sure for any other tall gals with normal torso lengths this would work great. The tie at the front was very flattering and the leg length was also as shown on the model. Really disappointed it didn't fit because I loved everything about it (minus the wedgie)!
Very lightweight, pockets, and beautiful color were all a plus. I don't think I have a long torso but the it is shorter from crotch inseam to shoulder.

links_reviews_title: Good romper for short ppl (like me!)
links_reviews_text: I love the cut and color of this outfit! My only complaint is that the stitching around the mid section doesn't have any stretch and can be a little annoying. Would likely rent again though. Pant crop ends at around the calf area so it's nice to pair with some heels :)

links_reviews_title: To short in the torso. I'm 5'7" 157 34dd
links_reviews_text: I did not wear

links_reviews_title: Fashion forward or pants on backwards?
links_reviews_text: This is my first jeans rental. The length is good for us shorties. I thought these would be fun and fashion-forward, but my 13 year old daughter says they look like I put my jeans on backwards! ;). And she has a point. Stiff denim so if you are between sizes I'd order up.
Went up one size, loved them!

links_reviews_title: Really cute. I got many compliments wearing them.
links_reviews_text: A little tight around the thighs and definitely high waisted. Overall they felt good.
Got during shelter in place. 70's vibe, didn't wear, but kind of cute

couldn't get these 25's over my hips and i am a 25 in every other brand. The material is thick w very little stretch... also a little HARD in the right size these would be perfect for casual friday's in spring

Wore this for holiday pictures and they turned out so cute. The color was perfect and the sweater was comfy. I decided to size down which I was happy about. Definitely low cut which I would be mindful of!
This is cozy, oversized sleeves and boxy fit with a hem that hits at the hip. I love the color and it's really soft. A fall staple!

links_reviews_title: Nice but casual sweater -- for work or everyday
Great item to wear and not have to store!
links_reviews_text: I love that I can push sleeves up. Great color, comfy, cozy. Nice V neck.

This sweater looks simple, and it is, but that's the genius- it goes with everything and every situation! I must have worn it at least 5 times. It's soft, the color is gorgeous, and it drapes perfectly - I'm obsessed with the v neck, slightly cropped length, and dolman sleeves. I'm even now still thinking about buying this sweater even though it's $300.....

links_reviews_title: I wish I would have bought this
links_reviews_text: I LOVED this sweater. I rented a M per the size chart and review (I'm 5'8", 145 lbs), but I wish I had rented a small. I have a small chest and the V on this V-neck cut pretty low on me. I had to pay attention to make sure my bralette didn't pop out at work. Other than that, I would definitely rent again!
The torso length was way too short and the V too deep; made for awkward fit. Arms were a good length.

Fit is naturally very loose, slightly cropped in the front once you let it sit where it wants to. Very soft and comfy, will go with everything. Wore with a bunch of gold layer necklaces and jeans and it was adorns.
Rented for work and ended up wearing it out to dinner too. Very easy to wear and stylish.
Loved the color and length.

links_reviews_title: Wore this just to run errands.
links_reviews_text: This sweater is so warm and cozy. The lambswool felt soft and luxurious, not itchy. It is more low cut than I expected but I just wore a bralette under it and my bralette didn't peek out. If you want more coverage you might want to layer a cami underneath. The sweater fit boxier on me than the model but it was still flattering and I loved how oversized it was, which prevented me from getting overheated when indoors.

links_reviews_title: Really great quality and not scratchy!
links_reviews_text: Great fit, deep V neck so wear a cute bralette and let it show!
Great sweater! Love it! Too low cut for work appropriate but perfect for the weekend. Runs large but that is exactly what I was hoping for with this sweater. :)

links_reviews_title: Cozy fall knit but DEEP vneck - don't size up
links_reviews_text: Rented this for every day and sized up for an oversized look but it ended up being too low/ a little frumpy (and fashion tape wouldn't stick). Would rent again but get my normal size. It is sooo soft and the color is very pretty. Nice cozy everyday
Not flattering. Didnât wear it

This was fun for a business day. I paired with a red skirt, whit top, and red shoes. Got quite a few compliments. The jacket was a bit squared and not super flattering at the waist, but was comfy all day. The sleeve details were fabulous. Wear it to for professional with flair.

Not even sure if I should be screaming from the roof tops how amazing this blazer is, because I want it to always be available as I'll be renting it on repeat. I held onto it for a few weeks this past time and got so many great looks styled with it. Seriously it's beautiful!! More @itsminefornow
Beautiful, thick blazer. Looks fantastic in person, runs a bit larger than other Veronica Beard blazers. Sleeves are on the shorter side but that's nice if you want to show off your accessories.
Veronica Beard does not disappoint. I usually wear a 6. The 4 fit nicely. Love this jacket!!!
I ended up wearing this a few times. The cut and fit were a bit different than my normal blazers and added some extra flare. Very comfortable and great for the fall.

links_reviews_title: Great for the office and the weekend
links_reviews_text: Easy jacket to mix & match. Liked it! True to size. Just a bit worn out (must have been rented several times in my size already)

Great Blazer..! I'm usually a 4P and this fit perfectly (5'3). It's perfect to throw over a casual outfit or dress it up for work. The sleeves are not too long, which is great because you can show off your accessories and there are two pockets to store items. I would definitely recommend :)
Fits well. Classic. Tons of compliments! Comfortable.
Wore for a presentation - liked it - super warm FYI - gave 3 stars as I liked it, but wasn't in love with it. Fits well and is stylish
I've rented a few of he Veronica beard blazers and love the style. Wanted this one for a while and finally was available Did not dissapoint!

links_reviews_title: Super cute, but I looked like an airline pilot
links_reviews_text: Probably should have sized down, I like a more fitted jacket
Looks amazing, feels amazing - qualitative & different. The fit was great. Wore it out to dinner, to work, etc. - love it.

Granted, I got confirmed for a flight attendant at the airport, but I wore this with jeans on the weekend and slacks and a skirt to work. I got so many compliments on this classic blazer. Great material, fits true to size and you will wear it Aga Ian and again!

This is definitely a fall weight jacket but my office is soo cold with air conditioner that it was perfect. I wore it with a sleeveless ruffled top, jeans and heels. Very sharp looking with the red accent on the sleeve and buttons. I wore it open but nice closed as well. True to size . I have broad shoulders and a 36c and it was a perfect!

This is a great sweater and I got to many complements when I wore it. I wear a small in a lot of tops but the medium fit great - I think the small would have been too short on me. I wish I owned this!

links_reviews_title: Cute sweater, that pop of color you need during winter
links_reviews_text: The color is perfect to brighten up the winter wardrobe. The balloon sleeve gives the sweater an extra pop. Since I'm taller (5'9") the sleeves were a tad short (when moving around) and the body of the sweater was slim and hit a little below the waist of my denim. I would maybe size up if one would like a bigger look. Would definitely rent again.
I loved this sweater. The color was beautiful and the fit was great. I would definitely rent it again.

This beautiful green sweater made my Thanksgiving festive. 100% cotton was cool enough to help in the kitchen, warm enough for a stroll outside at 47 degrees, and layers nicely with a coat when it got colder. I paired it with Sweet Baby Jamie's brown faux fur coat. I think the full sleeve was slimming/distracted from the girls. I got lots of compliments!
Super comfy sweater for a cold day. Perfect to dress up or dress down. Color is nice too.

Snatched this up because it's one of my fave colors. It's a soft sweater (though I was the first to wear it, had tags on when I received). The sleeves are great. Nothing out of this world, but nice brightness to introduce in the colder months.

links_reviews_title: I rented this for a St. Patricks day party, and it was perfect. It is a great green color.
links_reviews_text: The fit was a bit small in the waste, but I still wore it. The sleeves are a great touch. Can be dressed up or down. The fabric of the sweater is light, and not too heavy. Definitely recommend.
The sleeves were magnificent, compliments alllllll day.

Fit beautifully with a pair of high waisted skinny jeans. I enjoyed the color and received many compliments on the sweater. RTR is a great way to try trendy sweaters that otherwise have a shorter shelf-life in one's own closet.

links_reviews_title: Wore this to a family brunch with jeans and ankle booties. It was perfect for the occasion.
links_reviews_text: I liked the color of this sweater. I typically wear a M but renter this in a L. The fit was good.

I will reorder this in a medium. The fit is flattering as it's slimmer in the waist and I loved the full sleeves. I ordered this and wore it t work. Lots of compliments and it nicely paired with a bold patterned bottom.

Really liked this sweater. It's one I'd purchase. Pretty green, soft material and very flattering style. I wore it to work with black pants and again with jeans and boots for a night out. Loved it both times!
This sweater is cute. I love the pop of color and the fun sleeves. I rented for everyday and wore it for date night and to work. I would recommend
I thought this sweater was going to be heavy and thick but it was surprisingly light and soft. Had a bit of a smell to it. Loved the big sleeves.
Very comfortable and soft sweater. The puff sleeves also make the sweater more unique. Loved it. I'm also 6 months pregnant and the size small (my normal size) fit fine over my belly.
Great sweater to wear dressy or casual.
Love this sweater! Super soft, good quality, fits well. Wore with jeans and leopard flats to a Christmas performance.
I love everything about this sweater. It feels great on and it really cute! I am considering buying.
You can dress it up w/a chunky necklace and nice pants and consider it a night-out outfit, or you can throw it on with jeans and a pair of sneakers. Comfy, warm, and nice shape / style.
Great color for the holidays! Cute fitting sweater with a little extra detail with the sleeves.
fits true to size, not good for short arms as it looks like a lot of extra heavy material. I'm very petite but I'd recommend this for someone taller/with longer limbs than myself.
It's a bit more green looking than i expected, but i got sooooo man compliments i decided to just buy it! fits great!
This sweater is absolutely beautiful! It is super soft and comfortable and very flattering. I am really considering buying it!

links_reviews_title: Love the color; the puffy sleeves make this sweater extra comfortable!
links_reviews_text: Fits well, hits at the right spot on my hips (I'm 5ft9.5in) and doesn't add bulk to my frame even though the sleeves are puffy.
Comfortable and true to size. Was a great rental for everyday.
I wore this to a Christmas show. I loved the color and the sleeves.
I love this sweater especially the sleeves. The color is vibrant and can be worn with anything. Would definitely wear it again!
Too tight in the stomach and breast area.
Cute & comfortable sweater

links_reviews_title: comfortable. Great color. Good fall sweater.
links_reviews_text: Runs a little small but very comfy, I went up a size to get the oversized grandma look.
No complaints except it sheds a bit
Wore this to football tailgates and to some beach bars. Perfect for warm weather. Pair it with a jean jacket when it gets chilly. Dress it up a little more with booties.
Amazing dress! The belt runs a little tight- I would size up !

links_reviews_title: Wrinkly and short but a win
links_reviews_text: The dress wrinkled easily, but it was definitely a win! I'm 5'9" and my husband reminded me not to bend over all day! The dress was on the short side. It's super cute with the big buttons. The straps were HUGE and constantly falling down. Plenty of cons to the dress but I loved it so much I would ignore those cons and wear it again!
Loved this dress! Like other Nicholas, if you have a larger bust size up especially with the button closure down the front

I really wanted to love this dress, but it was just okay. I think it meant for people with a straight, athletic body type. I had to get the 16 to fit my hips, but the chest area was huge and the straps kept falling down. IG: @noellevenegas
Fit was slightly loose, but because it's linen it stretched out throughout the night. Enough to where it fit too big to wear a second time unfortunately. So cute though!

links_reviews_title: I felt like Steve Irwin's assistant in this dress...and I LOVED IT!
links_reviews_text: Safari linen chic - this dress is easy, breezy, fashionable. Got a ton of compliments - it did wrinkle easily but the belt kept the look going strong all day long. This color even looked good on my pale freckley skin! Try it - don't hesitate - this is a summer staple right here.

This was such a cute dress, but it runs very large! The belt didn't help. I had it in the tightest belt hole and it still was too large. Additionally, the straps were SOOO long they kept falling off my shoulder. I tried to pin the straps, but it was no use. I wore it for a couple of hours to run a couple of errands. Not a very practical fit.
Loved this!!!! Fun linen dress. Did run a bit big at the top and in the shoulders but a size down may have been too short as it was already pretty short. Definitely would rent again.
Wore this on vacation in Malibu and loved every second of it. Super comfy but does run a little short

I rented this for a friends birthday night out at a piano bar. I'm only 5'3" so the shoulder straps were a bit long for me, they didn't always lay right and were just a bit loose but overall o loved this dress it was so comfortable and perfect for a hot summer night. With all RTR dresses that are short I always wear boy shirts and it makes the dresses even more comfortable to be in. I'd rent this dress again.

Amazing. Love that this comes with a belt, hit perfectly. Great length (a little short but i still wore it to work - just dont bend down or lean over to far). This was my birthday dress of choice 3 nights in a row with different people each night. Its amazing.
Casual linen type but fancy enough for a nice dinner or any summer day event. Loved the buttons and the belt, which made the waist very flattering.
Loved the fit and the style! I wore this out to dinner on vacation, after party of a wedding, and on a date. Straps were a little loose on me, but I loved the dress.
Super cute & comfortable- perfect daily wear dress! I paired it with a Samantha Sipos jacket that's available on here!
Pretty dress perfect for vacation. Loved the length but the straps were really short so tight in that area.

links_reviews_title: Great fit & comfortable on hot summer days!
links_reviews_text: Fit is true to size. Thick linen material that doesnât wrinkle easily! Beautiful button closure with adjustable belt! Con, a button fell off and had to keep putting it back on!

I chose to layer this dress with sweaters and t-shirts and I loved it! I sized up and I'm glad I did because it was still a bit short on my 5'10" frame. It is linen so it will wrinkle easily but I didn't mind. Wish I owned this dress it is so versatile! The belt makes it cinch at the waist and be more flattering

I loved this! So easy and chic for summer, with a bit of a safari vibe. I wore this to a rehearsal dinner with nude strappy heels, and then wore again with flat sandals during the day and with white tennies. Considered buying it. It does run a little small. I am almost always a size 4, sometimes a 2, and I got the 6 because it was all that was available and it fit well. The 4 probably would have fit as well but i like it did being super tight.
I have a large chest, 36DD, and this dress was huge on top. Was large all around, but the belt helped cinch. The top was loose that it was bunch on the sides. Could not wear.
Loved this look, wore it with white sneakers and got so many compliment

This dress is cut kind of wide. I'm a 12 with an hour glass figure. More often that not I have to size up with the designers here but this was roomy. Oddly enough even with the room the buttons didn't lay perfectly and if I sat down there were gaps all over. There's no zipper, the buttons are your way in and out. The straps are also very long. All of this could have been fixed with pins and fashion tape but it was so short that any slight move and my but was out. I'm 5'8 and don't normally have lengthy problems with dresses to this extent. It's comically short. It's also linen and arrived too wrinkled to wear. This will not travel well, and you'll need a steamer or iron just to wear it. Lastly, and most frustrating- the belt is the wrong size. There's no sizing on the belt, but it's super tiny, clearly a smaller dresses belt (like an 8 probably) got mixed up here. So it's not usable bc it's super tight. If you have a straight body and are a bit shorter this dress would probably fit you much better. It was nice and light, definitely a summer linen. I wish I could have worn it bc it would have been perfect for the summer festival I planned to wear it to. So I do recommend those who are either shorter than 5'7 or don't mind their booty hanging out to try it. But even those with a runway model body will need pins for the straps, fabric tape for in between the buttons and a good steamer or iron.

links_reviews_title: The dress is super cute in person. Great quality fabric, cute buttons, and fun straps.
links_reviews_text: The dress was not fitted and too large to wear. Didn't swap for a smaller size because it was short enough.

links_reviews_title: Loved the look and feel of this dress. Cute and casual but dressed it up with heels and accessories
links_reviews_text: It is REALLY short. Just don't bend over much.

It's an adorable style. I'm afraid I have a bottom and it was just too short. It's a very thin linen like material and gets wrinkled easily. I just wish it was slightly longer as I'm a bigger girl and I would have shown all my assets.
The straps are a little big and it's a bit short, but it's super flattering.

links_reviews_title: Not great for tall women and the belt was wrong
links_reviews_text: Sizing wasn't great for a tall person - it got bigger in width rather than length. The belt was Laos the wrong size - not even the width of the waist of the dress.

Gorgeous, fits perfect. Even the model is wearing the last latch on the belt. So was I. But i felt like Kim Kardashian at the 2019 Met gala. Couldn't sit down comfortably. The dress fit perfect but is incomplete without the belt. SMH
Overall, would rent again. Pros - color - cut Cons - belt was pretty tight - the dress was not lined so you could see between the buttons if you moved certain ways
This is super cute, just wish I had been able to get a 4... runs a little on the smaller side.
Large chest will require a cami. Cute with black jeans
Wore to friend's 30th birthday party

Wore this twice; once out to dinner with friends and once to work. When I wore it to work I wore a cami underneath. Gorgeous colors and very flattering. Great with jeans or nice pants or a skirt for work. Very versatile. Just a little too much to spend on a blouse for me. Perfect to rent!

links_reviews_title: Most likely will need a cami
links_reviews_text: The color and butterfly patterns are beautiful but the criss cross front felt short waisted and did not hang in the best place. As you can see by the picture, very low plunge and I added a black cami because it was a work mixer. My first preference would have been a large but only xL was available. Still I am not sure I would be wowed.
LOVED this top! Almost bought it! Will definitely rent again. Looks and feels like luxury. Many, many complements!
Loved this beautiful top! It's so feminine and soft. The design is very flattering and unique, and the fabric is soft and flowy. Highly recommend!!!
The photo doesn't do it justice. The draping and the details are really stylish. And the fabric print and colors are bright and beautiful.
Cute top fits TTS. Wore with a black pencil skirt to work.

This is perhaps a tiny bit too low cut for work in my opinion. The bottom part is also wrap-style and might show midriff if you move the wrong way. It was fine, my office isn't strict and I wore it for a day anyway, but was just a little self-conscious about it. I love the print though, and the sleeves are a beautiful shape with nice drape. I would love to rent this again to wear with jeans on the weekend.

Beautiful shirt. Loved the color and the pattern. For me it just didn't work. My bra was completely showing. No amount of tape helped either. I could cover myself at all. Ended up taking it off and changing 45 minutes into the work day. I guess it didn't work because I have a shorter torso? Not enough length to make the neckline taut. I typically have problems with wrap style clothing, so I should've known better.
Really pretty top. Had to wear a cami because it was so low cut.

links_reviews_title: Cute but not for small busts
links_reviews_text: I did not end up wearing this as the fit was not right for my body. The print and color were great, but the chest and waist were really large. I am an hourglass shape with a small chest and this was just way too baggy.
Sleeve a little snug around the wrist, hard to get hand through without unbuttoning and who has time to do that! Flattering though, and pretty pattern
Great fit and very flattering !
I didn't love this - as someone who is 5'3" I felt like I was swimming in the blousy sleeves, and there was too much fabric around the midsection.

I thought the design was odd, but friends who also do RTR Unlimited liked the detail and thought it added interest. I love butterflies, so the print made me happy. :) I wouldn't buy it, but this top was easy to wear and comfortable.
This top really emphasized my waist. It's dressy enough for a nice dinner out but not over the top. The 10 fit true to size.

I wanted to love this top but the fit wasn't the most flattering on me. It ran pretty big and I needed to safety pin the front to keep it from gaping open. I loved the pattern and it was definitely a cute work shirt but wasn't my favorite due to the fit.
This is such a pretty top!
Beautiful fabric but very unflattering.
Really pretty top w jeans
Light fabric, pretty pattern. A little low cut in the front for work environment so I wore a black cami underneath.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful fabric and pattern. Great to dress up or down.
links_reviews_text: A bit tight all around and difficult to put on and take off.
Not bad with blue jeans, tight for movements in the arms & chest
I really lived this blouse- very flattering and beautiful on. Will definitely get this one again!

The neckline could have been too low cut if I had sized up. I am a 4 or a 6 and went with the 4 here. No complaints. I'm 5'7 , 140 lbs. small C ...Really flattering and comfortable to wear. Wore once to church w black slacks and again to a family reunion with jeans. I like tops that are no fuss since I've got two toddlers to chase . This made me feel put together instantly.

This shirt is so flattering I ordered a 12 because the 14 was not available. The 12 fit but is was a little tight so I am sending back and will wait for the 14 to become available. I can't say enough about the cut it is so flattering. I am 5'2 185 38C
I wanted to love this, and the fabric is pretty... but it's far too short unless you have a more compact torso.
Great material and a fun fit. It's definitely oversized, but still fits well through the shoulders. I would totally rent this again
Perfect blazer for work or for a party, depending on how it's styled! It's warm but not so warm that it's a winter coat. Great length for my height.
Fits true to size. Stunning blazer. Top notch quality. Loved it !!

I wore this to work with a belt. It was a tiny bit too big for me, but I think a size down would've been too small. I added the belt to define my waist. It was a thick/comfortable material. Love the print for fall/winter!
This jacket is a little boxy and best worn as a light outdoor jacket if you are not super tall and thin. Got a ton of compliments on it and it goes with just about anything.
Wore this to work with jeans and sneakers. Blazer is made so well you can tell it an expensive piece. Loved it.
This blazer is some kind of wool blend so it is very warm. I worried about the white getting dirty throughout the day, but it's actually more of an off white. I received a lot of compliments.

Love this coat! I usually wear a size 8 and got a size 8 based on the reviews. It definitely is oversized, as expected. Not tight at all, even in the arms. The stripes are red and black. For some reason I thought they were more navy than black when I first saw the item on the website. I wanted to wear this as a blazer to work at first but it is so heavy/thick/warm/oversized that I'm wearing it more as a fall coat. Love this!
Great quality blazer that got so many compliments. Ran slightly big but it's meant to have the oversized look. Seriously have no complaints, just rent it.

links_reviews_title: Soft wool, modern but classic look
links_reviews_text: Soft wool fabric feels great. The cut of the lapel is updated and tailored really nicely. Got compliments from many ppl and have rented it twice now. I wear with black skinny jeans and sneaks or dress up with block heels. The button buttons and didn't feel too small.

links_reviews_title: Fabulous! Pulls together an outfit but still feels playful, would definitely rent again!

links_reviews_text: I got a lot of compliments on this blazer at work. I paired it with jeans and a tshirt and wanted to wear it over and over. The material is thick so it's definitely for a cooler climate, but it's very soft and comfy.
Great jacket... very comfortable, tailored fit - has shoulder pads if that means anything to you. Like other reviews say - It's definitely more of a warm jacket than a blazer. Great for winter

links_reviews_title: Great classic blazer. LONG. Fit me perfectly at 5'10.
links_reviews_text: Great material. Very pretty. I think this is definitely for a taller person but worked well on me.
This blazer is great for a casual holiday party. It's a cute oversized blazer that's surprisingly snuggly. I expected the material to be rigid, but it is a soft wool. Enjoy!
I wore this to work with a light weight black sweater underneath, jeans and a pair of black sneakers.Perfectly work appropriate perfectly warm, yet unique in style.

links_reviews_title: Wore it to work - got a lot of compliments
links_reviews_text: True to size
I chose this thinking it would be a good office jacket, but it's a heavier wool and over sized. I ended up wearing it more as a coat, but still stylish. The sleeves were long also, so had to roll.
I love this blazer. It fits well, it's versatile, it's warm. Perfect for fall. I would recommend true to size since it's an oversized fit. Just be prepared for an oversized look
Perfect for late summer and early fall. This jacket was thin though so definitely not for colder temps. I wore it on a 50F day and it was a tad too thin. Overall, loved the cut and colors!

First, my husband complimented me when I wore this which goes to show how awesome the blazer is. He even told me to buy it! I loved this because it was warm (my office is freezing) and it was a fashion statement without much effort. Just pair it with some boyfriend jeans, loafers and a white tee.

I wanted to love this oversized blazer, but the fact is not only is it oversized - it's really bulky. The shoulder pads add a lot of unnecessary "heft" to this blazer and it's just not flattering. I tried to wear as a jacket instead of a blazer, but it just looked awkward and hit at a really awkward length.

links_reviews_title: Super chic and modern. You can throw this over anything to level up your outfit. Well constructed.
links_reviews_text: Oversized modern chic thick warm

links_reviews_title: This is a wool coat, not really a blazer!!
links_reviews_text: I ordered this thinking it was a blazer that I could wear to work but it's actually a wool coat (not really something you would want to wear in the office). It's a super cute coat, but I live in the south and it's still 100 degrees so no way could I wear it anywhere - guess I will have to wait for the winter. I wouldn't wear it as a blazer as it is a little bulky and really heavy.

links_reviews_title: Great for a big work event
links_reviews_text: I rented this for a big presentation at work and got tons of comments. A bit too warm for late summer, but would have been perfect further into fall!
Intentionally Oversized which I loved

I loved this blazer. It's wool and feels more like a coat, but it worked well for my evening event for a work conference. I got so many compliments from clients and impressed them with all the pockets! Wore it with jeans and a green shirt with cole haan wingtip sneakers. Will definitely rent again!

The print on these is great - a very bold herringbone houndstooth. Nice and warm for winter, cropped but not too short. I ordered up a size bc I find yo sizes often fit small but these were true to size and I would go to the 6 if I ordered again.

links_reviews_title: Cool pants, but thick. Good for winter.
links_reviews_text: Thick wool pant with cool wide leg flare. The only downside was the lining rides up as it's only on part of the pants. If you're sensitive to wool, you'll probably itch. Otherwise I loved it for the unique look it's easy to match tops.
I ordered a size up and they fit perfectly! Must wear with tights or else they will become itchy against your skin.
Got compliments on these pants, The only negative is that the wool is itchy and they aren't fully lined.

links_reviews_title: The pants are super cute but the lining is badly sized and uncomfortable
links_reviews_text: Pros: thick winter pants, very loose on the bottom cute in general Cons:fit is strange, butt looks weird, lining all miss shaped
If your 5'4 or shorter they will be full length
As others have mentioned, they're not lined all the way down, but that didn't bother me. Received tons of compliments. I'm generally a 2 and wore a 6R.
These pants were way too tight. I sized up per others' reviews but could've used to go up two sizes. The pants were warm and high quality, bummed I didn't get to wear them.
Great, fun pants. Like the length, it's kind of funky.

links_reviews_title: I would have enjoyed pairing these with my cute new boots.
links_reviews_text: I wear a 32 in jeans and the 14 was not even close to buttoning. They are cute though and would be great for cold winter work days.
The pants are way too long for someone who is 5'2.

These fit fine in the waist/hip (I'm 5'6", 130, and the 10R was right) but the length was awful on me. right at the mid-ankle. They were voluminous enough that the length just looked strange. As a true culotte, maybe the wide leg would have worked. Too bad. Cute, cozy fabric.

links_reviews_title: Great, sturdy pants for cold winter days
links_reviews_text: I wore these pants several times during cold winter days to work, usually with a fitted black turtleneck tucked in. Overall the pants looked as expensive as they are. They were great for injecting a little "style" into my conservative office dress code -- I still felt professional and polished. One minor fit note was that the waist cinched in a little tighter than expected (this is generally not an issue with how pants fit me) which created a very slight pooch that was probably not noticeable to anyone but myself.
Loved these, so warm for cold weather, not fully lined which was odd but it was lined in the waist butt and thighs.

links_reviews_title: Heavy weight, high quality pants. Perfect for winter work days.
links_reviews_text: Fit is good, but one size down would have been perfect - I normally wear a size 6. The hem hit right at my ankle. Looks great with a slim ankle boot and comfy sweater for a relaxed but stylish work look.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful high quality pants but run small
links_reviews_text: These are gorgeous wool and silk lined pants! Super high quality. I loved them but they were just too small for me. Size up! They're really warm too!

I loved the look of the pants but I couldn't make them work. I'm normally a size 10/12. In this the recommended size was 14, which is what I ordered. The hips and thighs fit well. the waist, not so much. I could get the waist buttoned but, it was far too tight for me to comfortably wear all day. I'm 5'7" and love a cropped pant...this felt a smidge long, definitely not as short as the model photo.

Gorgeous quality, thick knit pant. Print is bolder than pictured and looks very luxe. They are only lined to mid things, but since they are wide leg I didn't find this to be uncomfortable. They are of course wool so if you are sensitive to itchy fabrics, I would not rent these.

As the other reviewers mentioned, they are a bit itchy.... but at the end of the day, they are very flattering, perfect combination of classic and distinct. Plus I got a lot of compliments! I would definitely rent again, especially for those days that feel "in between seasons" since they're cropped.

This ran true to size in the waist, but really large everywhere else, including the length. I'm only 5'4" and I was swimming in these pants all day. If I had ordered a smaller size, the waist would have been too tight and it still would have been too long.
not fully lined and scratchy! with tights and boots it might work, but not on bare legs I am size 8-10 and the 14 in this is tight

links_reviews_title: loved it worn it a lot.
links_reviews_text: little big
Wore this to Italy and was the perfect top and look!
So cute and comfy. Honestly would have liked to keep it.
Just wore this for brunch and running errands around town. Super comfy but also cute. Would rent again to take on vacation!
I knew it was going to be too big but it was comfortable and oversized in a positive way. Very soft and comfortable. Wore to work and wine tasting

I really liked this shirt. The reason for a loss of a star is for the gap where it buttons - sometimes you could see into the shirt which was annoying and there wasn't a great way to remedy. Otherwise, it's cute and comfy. I wore is all day sightseeing.
Way bigger than I expected. Too baggy for me to even wear
Too large overall and not a lot of shape to it. Cute pattern though.
Light and airy, flattering fit. More cropped than I expected but still a great top

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it.
links_reviews_text: Great comfortable everyday shirt. Can dress up or down. Wore it to the beach and to office meetings.

I love linen tops and I love the colors and design of this top. It's a little short for me and I'm short waisted. The buttons gape to where you can see skin so a cami can help but the cami was sticking out of the bottom because it was short so I didn't wear it because it looked awkward. I think it would look great on a 20- something thin, smaller breasted woman.
Lightweight and easy to wear. I wore this multiple times during my summer trip in South America.

This top has a great breezy material which was perfect for a warm weather vacation. It did run a little bit big. I was fine in my usual size, but I'd recommend sizing down if in between sizes or for a more fitted look. Overall I liked this top!
The fit was great since I got an XXL (I wear 14 and some 16s). Perfect shirt to throw on and go. I'll definitely be renting again and have already worn it twice!

Didn't have my M size (as usual) so I had to get the L, which was too big. It's already a pretty roomy, loose top. I wore it anyway, but I definitely would have held onto it longer if I had had the proper size. The length is great and even in the too-big size it wasn't too low cut. Material is breezy, great for warm weather.
Wore with white jeans to a baseball game. Casual and sexy. Didn't show too much skin.

This dress if and good for vacation, but you definitely need to size down. I am a size 14 and went with the XXL and it was far too large. If I had gone for the XL I would have worn with a cami underneath as it is sheer and the buttons do gape. A cute top if you can find the right fit.
I wore this on vacation and it was very light and breezy which was great.
Lightweight and flattering. Neckline is not too low and buttons add nice details.
Soft fabric and comfortable to wear, just was a bit too baggy. Would size down.

This top was an amazing top for vacation - light and airy but also does not wrinkle. It is perfectly summery and runs TTS. Given the tied front it is a bit short, but not too much so. I loved this piece!

The fabric was a very breathable linen that made it comfortable to wear in 90 degree heat. Was a bit big on me as the Small but I should have gotten the XS (wasn't available). The small was still wearable and looked great with white denim shorts

Love this shirt. Fits TTS for a comfortable fit. Such a soft material. Gaps in front with the way the buttons are placed but you can wear a tank/camisole with it easily if you want. Hits at waist without being too short. Perfect for summer.

I ordered a medium (size 4-6) and definitely should have gotten the small (which wasn't available at the time). I think I could have fit an XS too, the fit is extremely loose. Still a cute, casual shirt.
Nothing special, except maybe the fabric, which was really soft. I probably should have ordered a small.

super cute casual top I wore to work on a more casual day. You definitely need a camisole underneath because the button's are a bit gappy. I probably needed the large or xl. this was just really big but made it work.
Light, airy top
This was a little big on me I should've gotten a size or two smaller but I made it work because it can be a loose/summery look. Loved the fabric, very comfortable.
It's not super warm but cute and easy to wear!

links_reviews_title: Sweater is meant to have close fit.
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater! It is more comfortable than I would have expected (the fabric on the sleeves makes it feel roomy there). I normally wear a small, and the small fits perfectly, but it is a close fitting style. I am long waisted. The sweater hit just below my belt. That said, I wore a thin black camisole underneath, which may be why length was not an issue for me. I am very petite on top (shoulders and chest); this may also be part of the reason it worked.
I really like this shirt a lot!
I am short waisted and it hit right at the top of my hips. The print on the sleeves definitely made the top. Loved and and will rent again.
This top fits 0/XS like a perfect glove. Fabric is soft and the sleeves are an absolute charm. Wish the buy price was more reasonable, wanted to keep it!

links_reviews_title: Cute shirt, ran a little small
links_reviews_text: You can dress up or down, I liked the sleeves

links_reviews_title: Animal print added some pop to an ordinary sweater
links_reviews_text: Gorgeous sweater, easy to wear, very comfortable. Would definitely wear more of this brand again.

Wore this sweater to Thanksgiving with my family. It was really comfortable and super cute. I loved the lightweight material of the sleeves, and I like that this can be dressed up or down. Highly recommend.
Fits true to size. I was happy with the look and feel of the material.
Flattering and comfortable. Got lots of compliments.
Great top, was too see through for work. Liked it a lot!
Sleeves are a bit short. Top slightly see through. Can see bra.
The sleeves are super cute. It's very short - almost crop top on me. There was a rip on the sleeve so I didn't wear it although I probably wouldn't have worn it anyways due to how short it was on me.

links_reviews_title: Runs small in some spots, runs large in others
links_reviews_text: Per other reviewers, i sized up on this one. Even a size larger than my usual just barely hits the top of my jeans. The sleeves are poofy and kind of weird - especially after needing to size up. This top was definitely kind of a miss.
I did not wear. Tops runs short, small and material is a bit scratchy.
a bit tight and slightly see-through, but cool sleeves

links_reviews_title: Wore for work and it's a great way to add a dress into the dead of winter!
links_reviews_text: It's been in the teens for weather and I wore this dress to work where we have to walk outside here and there and the thick fabric paired with the jacket held up great. I saw a lot of reviews about the dress being too short or mini but for me it was long enough to be professional, so if you are a shorter woman- go for this! I loved it.

links_reviews_title: Cute and can be used in every season!
links_reviews_text: Great work piece that is comfortable but not boring. Got tons of compliments. It did feel a little short when I was sitting.
This dress gave me LIFE SIZE vibes when Tyra banks goes to work for the first time. I felt like a million bucks in this dress - it was comfortable and fitted. Would recommend to anyone!!
Adorable dress, perfect for layering with a long sleeve t-shirt or turtleneck in the winter, or wearing as is in the summer. Runs slightly small, so size up!

This dress is amazing! It was a perfect dress to kick off fall: sleeveless, so a layered cardigan was appropriate; short, so I could wear it with my over-the-knee boots; and thick fabric, so I wasn't freezing in my icebox of an office! Love, love, love.
I love the fit and fabric. I am tempted to purchase. It is a classic piece and so versatile.
Cute dress. Could have been a little more fitted. Good for work but needed a tank underneath.
Nice dress, nice heavy fabric, great fit and length. Ordered a size up and it was perfect!
I sized up for length and it was perfect on me. I can see on a taller person, this might be too short for the office. It's also a heavy material but just for an air conditioned office in the summer.
Short length nice since I'm 5-4
The dress was cute with a sweater/turtleneck underneath. Got compliments throughout the day! I go between a 2-6 and I'm glad I ordered a 6 to be work appropriate.
Dress was beautifully made. Based on reviews I read that it ran a bit small so I sized up. Comfortable, gorgeous details. Highly recommend!

links_reviews_title: Too big for small chested women
links_reviews_text: This was cute but I couldn't wear it. The bottom was only slightly big but the top was huge and looked ridiculous.

There is definitely something to be said for wearing a $600 dress out for a nice dinner. I would not have spent that much on a dress for myself, but love that the boost of confidence that wearing a well-made and designer dress gave me while having dinner at a high end restaurant for my husband's birthday. The dress definitely runs small. After recently losing 82 pounds, I'm very aware of sizing. I would normally wear a 12, but the 16 fit perfectly, especially over my ample breasts. But the structure and fit of the dress let me go without any type of Spanx type devices which was pleasant for a long dinner out.
This dress was very comfortable! However, I might size down in the future. I could grab a handful of fabric in the back to see how a smaller size might fit. Still, it worked great for TV/work.
I got so many compliments on this at work. It's such a classic dress. I actually wore a tight white long sleeve underneath it and it was so perfect. Will definitely rent again
Loved this dress and will definitely be renting many more times! It was a little short on me (for work), but still manageable. Fit perfectly, material was very nice, cute button detail.
Fit well all over except too short. I wore with leggings and that saved it. Great quality fabric and buttons.

No give in the hips for pear or hourglass shape. For me, I could have sized down to a 6 for a more fitted look. When I order again in the spring when the weather is warmer, I'll go for a 6 and without the turtle neck. Real pockets

links_reviews_title: A bit snug, short and low cut
links_reviews_text: The overall fit of this dress is small. I went up a size and still needed to go up another. It was also quite short and low cute and I usually prefer one or the other. The fabric is beautiful though! It's a very sturdy well made dress - but definitely size up at least one size.
Runs small so I ordered a size larger than what i normally wear, and it fit like a glove. Hands down my favorite thing I've ever rented
Fit so well in all the right places. If Veronica Beard fits you well, this dress will look awesome.
Loved this dress. Could have easily sized down to a 10

I wore this dress to work with a black long sleeve shirt underneath and received so many compliments! I can see why others would suggest to size up, as it is a bit short. I read the reviews in advance so I did size up and the length was perfect for me. Would definitely order this again!
Flatters and puts curves where curves should be. The fabric is a bit too heavy for end-of-summer wear, but it certainly looks and feels expensive.

links_reviews_title: Loved this dress and texture in the fabric. Easy to wear.
links_reviews_text: Wore to a dinner party and got loads of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Too short for me but very chic!
links_reviews_text: Ran a little short but still wearable. LOVE the design, looks very Chanel
This is a beautiful dress that has great fabric that is durable, good for fall! But way too small in the busy. Overall cute but runs small! Order up!
This dress was thick and fit amazingly. It ran slightly large but it made it more comfortable to wear. Got so many compliments!

Like a lot of VB dresses, this one ran small in the midsection and skirt - the top was true to size. Too small for me on the bottom half and sizing up would make it too big on top. Also, it's very short! Adorable and well made designer dress but sadly not for my shape.

Cute dress for work. Would have loved to wear it except it was too long in the shoulder to bust area. I'm drawn to structured dresses, but if everything doesn't fit exactly right, then you're pretty much out of luck. Probably fits body types that look good in black halo well.

links_reviews_title: So disappointed - I ordered up a size and this dress was so skin tight I couldn't even wear it!
links_reviews_text: Way too tight.
Thick material. Too short for work. Didn't end up wearing it.

links_reviews_title: I rented it for work but it is TOOOO short. So cute otherwise.
links_reviews_text: I rented it for work but it is TOOOO short. So cute otherwise.
Fit nicely, appropriate for work

links_reviews_title: Loved this- would rent for work
links_reviews_text: A little low cut, but cute dress and well made!
Very fun summer dress for the beach side. Took about 10 minutes to zip and 15 minutes to unzip. Returned without wearing out due to this struggle.
I felt like this was a little too short for work and I'm big busted and had too much cleavage. Now for a date night, 100% amazing.
I love this dress although it is a little inappropriate for work. It's short so flats only and probably a cami underneath and it works for a day at the office.

This dress is fitted in the waist and looser through the hips. It hit mid-thigh on me (5"5'). Wore with black loafers and cat-eye sunglasses during the day, and beige stiletto pumps at night. I felt like coco chanel running around the city in this :)
Wow, I'm a M/L and this runs LARGE. It wasn't cutely oversized, it was awkwardly so.

links_reviews_title: Love so much, I had to keep it.
links_reviews_text: The perfect everyday, but colorful sweater you are looking for. Perfectly chunky and warm but still super cute and flattering. The sweater is a little longer, which I liked because I'm tall, but just a heads up. Decided to keep this sweater After I wore it so much!
I seriously think I wore this every other day of my month with this one. Such a great color. So cozy and could be dressed up or down.

I don't normally wear pink because it doesn't work with my skintone imo, but wow this sweater made me feel amazing!! So soft, perfect shape, and great for chilly spring days. Received many compliments.

Really great sweater, bright color, super comfortable and soft and thick. Fit is oversized. Basic style but a few really nice details - I liked the thick cable knit at the bottom and neck and the seaming at the arms.
Loved wearing this pop of color! This sweater was great. It's meant to be oversized. Super warm and on the thicker side so it was perfect for winter in NYC :)
Loved this sweater! It was definitely oversized and I could have ordered one size smaller and still achieve a slightly oversized look.

Immediately was drawn to the color and received many compliments, but there was just so much fabric I had a hard time styling this piece. Tried to do a front tuck so it didn't look so large - wish it had more shape.
Love this sweater! Runs big but loved the oversized feel!

I was so excited about this sweater because of the bright color, but it runs so so big! I felt like I was swimming in it. I ended up wearing it with black leather leggings and heels and had to roll the sleeves up twice. Overall it's a cute sweater just make sure you order 1-2 sizes down.

It's kind of hard to find clothes with vivid cool-tone colors but it is def the one! Great quality. Bulky and oversized but that's the charm. I really like it and wear it pairing with jeans, skirts, and even long dresses! Kudos to RTR!

I got the Medium and wore it with leggings. The drop shoulder made the M definitely look more oversized - I'm a 4/6 and would get a small if I was going for a neater look. I love the bright color. The sweater itself thick but seems like more of a cotton blend so it's comfy for a chilly spring day or chilling indoors.
This sweater is so tragic and much more magenta in real life. I wanted to be obsessed with it and took it off immediately and sent it back. Not flattering, it was super boxy and big.

This sweater was super cozy for the winter, I wore it through my second trimester and while it was loose it was still flattering. If not pregnant I would have sized down. The pink stands out and I got a lot of compliments on it. Would defiantly rent again while not pregnant for winter wear can be paired with pants or a skirt easily and looks very chic.

The color is very striking and would be perfect for Valentine's Day. I paired it with a long black skirt with bold colored pattern, black tights and black suede boots. Also looks cute with tighter fitting pants and booties or heels. This sweater provided me just the right amount of warmth. Beware you may need looser fitting coat to fit in the bulky-ness of this sweater.

links_reviews_title: Edgy cut makes color shockingly versatile
links_reviews_text: This sweater is capital P I N K pink. But because it's oversized - and I mean really, the only thing that will fit are the shoulders but in a good way - it's one of those pieces that can be edgy or sweet but not too Limited Too. Ended up buying it and I wear it all the time
This color is amazing and great to brighten up a dreary fall / winter day! It is definitely oversized but didn't look giant. I wore the XS and am typically a size 2.

This sweater is designed to fit oversized and is very on trend. In the first 2 hours I had it on, I was stopped by four strangers asking me about it. It's nice and soft and has a center back seam for unique detail. I wore it with dark black skinny jeans and booties just like the model.
Fits like a loose sweater. Very well made. Got a lot of compliments!

This is my favorite thing in the world, although I will say there was a bit of a mixed reaction among co-workers (it is possible this is a "man repellent," but who cares, honestly...). The color is so bright and rich but there are enough high-quality details that it doesn't look cheap or young. I would recommend getting your true size rather than sizing up for a loose fit - this is one where you should just trust the design process to get the look you are going for. I would keep this one forever if summer wasn't here!
Ran very big, very substantial so wasn't great for tucking.
This color was PERFECTION! The sweater is super heavy and thick though so even though it's a springy color, only wear this if you're somewhere you're going to be cold.
Nice color and sweater, sized down from medium to small and liked the fit. Would rent again!
Way too big to wear. Unflattering
Very comfortable - great for work or the weekend. Can dress this up or down

links_reviews_title: DO NOT RENT UNLESS YOU WANT TO LOOK LIKE A TENT
links_reviews_text: I thought this would be a cute sweater but turns out it was actually the perfect circus tent! This was an enormous monstrosity and not flattering in any way, whatsoever. Seriously, avoid at all costs.

links_reviews_title: Show stopping color but too boxy
links_reviews_text: Stunning color. Worn more for warmth, rather than for a flattering fit.

links_reviews_title: Really fun color that stands out. Very comfortable.
links_reviews_text: It's an over-sized sweater so runs a little large. Wore it with leather leggings and booties for a party when it was cold out.
This sweater runs big and wasn't flattering. The arms were really wide and made me look like a football player. It is the cutest color and I wanted to love it but just didn't.
LOL this sweater is crazy big and the sleeves are super awkward looking. You must downsize if you don't want to look like a bright pink clown!
This is a super warm sweater that I got compliments on every time I wore it. Have loved it for cold days with jeans or even sweats.
Amazing sweater! Wouldn't get the XS so went with the S and it was still a good fit. Lovely soft material and it was so bright. Lots of compliments and will certainly rent again
Loved this sweater, it's a little oversized and very bright!
Definitely oversized. The color is not as vibrant in person, more of a dark pink. I didn't end up wearing as it just wasn't flattering.
Its a nice sweater, pretty warm but it was also very itchy. I wore it two sizes small and still had an oversized look.

Not itchy but not particularly soft or snuggly either. This sweater is a nice weight and covers my butt with leggings. I wasn't crazy about the shape (basically A-line) but it was a fine, warm sweater to brighten up cold January days.
I think I wore this like 4 times creating different looks w it. The quality is top shelf and the color - WOW!
I loved the color of this sweater! So fun and bright. Only complaint is I was very warm when I wore it.
Great color but not a flattering fit. Fit weird in the arm area. Returned without wearing
Overworn and stretched
Everyone was obsessed with this dress!!! True to normal ref sizes

links_reviews_title: Can't go wrong with this dress
links_reviews_text: I rented the green version of this dress and LOVED it so I got this one too and it was super cute too! I rented a 2 last time which was ok with spanx, so this time I got a 4 so I could run around and be comfortable. I wore it all day to a museum and it was comfy and very pretty! You can check out more rtr rentals hon my ig @lizzparty if you want!

This was a hard dress to figure out. I had to wear a size up, but that size was a little roomy in the boobs. I tried wardrobe tape and three different types of bras. Finally gave up and just wore a pretty bra that peeked out the sides. The shape of the dress is made for a small waist and big chest. I'm an athletic barrel type body, so it was not a perfect match for me but I liked it anyway once I figured out how to wear it.
Loved it. Was flattering, comfy and modest!

links_reviews_title: Compliments on the dress, but overall it was a hassle
links_reviews_text: The dress was a hassle to wear and I had to take a few steps to make it work for me. As another reviewer said, it fits well above the waist, but waist and hips down are tight. Size up if you've got wide hips! If I had worn my normal size, this never would've worked. From waist down, the dress is lined, but the top is unlined. This mean that my tattoo could show through the fabric, which I didn't want for work. Additionally, the front was too low to wear to work without a cami. You'll also need to wear shape wear for the dress to lay flat on you while wearing a cami and any undergarments. So while I got a few compliments while wearing this, I wish I had known all the steps I would need to take to make this dress work for me before I rented.
The fabric is pretty and light. I liked the sleeve detail. The cut is a bit too low to wear a bra. Ok for me (32b) but may not work for some.
I love this pattern! Unfortunately this dress was too small for me. I have a lot of Reformation and typically wear a 4 or have to size up to a 6. This 6 didn't even fit. Will try the 8.

links_reviews_title: Very low cut and long torso
links_reviews_text: I'm usually a size 8, but rtr suggested a size 10. I think I would have been better off with an 8, but I'm not sure. The fit was weird. It's very low cut, which I expected, but the waist also hit low on me. If I could have raised the whole dress by an inch it would have fit perfectly. It was a tad loose in the waist so maybe if I'd had a smaller size it would have fit, but there is no stretch so I probably wouldn't have been able to sit down.

links_reviews_title: Weird gap caused by button placement

links_reviews_text: Gorgeous and fun dress but VERY revealing on the bust and tight on the waist but it was fun for a day!

links_reviews_title: Way too small even when following size charts
links_reviews_text: I normally wear a 4 or 6. Couldn't button this dress.
hard to wear a bra with it. a little bit too booby.
The fabric is so pretty, and maybe on someone else, it wouldn't gape, but on me it gaped unflatteringly at the buttons at the hips. Definitely couldn't wear it.
Canât even button up this dress. Iâm usually a 4 or 2. So this dress fits very small. Iâm 5â7, 34 b and about 130.
Love this brand but I would size up when ordering this dress, also runs small in the bust.
The other reviews are right- the chest is way too loose / revealing, I just don't know how i could wear this.

links_reviews_title: I didn't like it as much as I had hoped
links_reviews_text: Pretty dress and nice flow, but I didn't LOVE it. Normally I'm a 6 but wore a 10. I probably could have worn an 8 and maybe it would have been more flattering. I'm going to try some other Reformation dresses.
Sooo low cut which is a bummer but pretty cute worn with a camisole underneath

I rented this in a 4 and a 6 even though I'm normally 2/4 and have worn xs and s reformation before. I couldn't even get the 6 to fit. It's tight through the hip and rib cage. Would be cute if it were the right size
I'm a true 12, sometimes even a 10 on top, and this dress barely buttoned at my waist. The top is very low cut and slightly sheer. I wish this would have fit because it's cute! I recommend sizing up.

links_reviews_title: Absolutely obsessed with this dress. You can't beat Reformation.
links_reviews_text: Waist runs small, so it can either be true to size or a little small. The dress is light and airy - perfect for August in New York. The front dipped a little lower than I had expected, so I was a little disappointed that I wasn't able to wear it to work. Great weekend day-outfit!

links_reviews_title: Pretty dress, runs a little small and then the buttons pulled when you sit down.
links_reviews_text: Low cut, rented fro work and couldn't wear it until the weekend but nice pattern.
It was super small around the torso and very low cut. I'm normally a 6 but this felt like a 4.

links_reviews_title: Made for a specific body type
links_reviews_text: Really wanted to love this Reformation dress, but the buttons gaped At the waist despite sizing up. I am a true hourglass body type, and I just don't think this dress is meant for curvier women. The sleeves and print were beautiful though.
Nice sheer material and the print and color was pretty. However, the neckline was way too low and I have to pin it together for it to be work appropriate.
Flattering fit, a little on the large side for a 0
I've worn Reformation before so I got my typical size. The dress was really tight in the ribs and gapped between buttons. Did not end up wearing to event. Bummer because it's really cute!

links_reviews_title: No stretch on the waist, very low top. Beautiful color.
links_reviews_text: Great looking dress but since is has no stretch on the waist and it is enclosed by buttons after eating you will get the weird button stretch unless you are super skinny and found the perfect fit. The top is very low and a little loose for someone with a smaller bust size. But the color and pattern is beautiful so if you got that flat tummy go for it!

The top part of this dress was completely sheer, which was unexpected from the description. It was also very low cut. The material was thin and flimsy feeling overall, rather than flowy and breezy as I expected. Didn't wear.

links_reviews_title: The top is too low, make me uncomfortable to wearing out the house
links_reviews_text: Beautiful dress just too sexy for me

I got this with the tags on and returned with the tags on. The top and waist fit fine but it was a little more snug in the hips than I wanted. It's also very low cut. I decided not to fuss around with a Cami and spanx for a dress that looked mediocre at best. Kinda cheap looking.

I thought this bag was so fun. It can be worn multiple ways. I kept it short and over the shoulder. You can also play around with the orange chain which I thought was cool (use it as part of the strap or to accessorize the bag, as shown). It was smaller than I thought but worked out perfect for my event.

Loved the hem but otherwise the skirt is just ok. It has a fly, belt loop and pockets like a pair of trousers, which are details I dislike on skirts because they add bulk and affect the fit and styling possibilities.
Love the retro vibe of this sweater. Wore a few times and wish I could buy!
Got so many compliments on this cute, slightly cropped turtleneck. Sleeves hit just long enough. Material is warm enough for NY winter but didn't make me overheat.

links_reviews_title: A perfect pair with a 70s vibe
links_reviews_text: I rented this tote to use for several weeks as my work bag, and didn't even realize when I rented the sweater that they match perfectly! Loved this pairing. The bag is very spacious with a middle divider pocket that zips. The sweater was the perfect fit for my petite frame and very warm without being itchy. Overall a huge win!

links_reviews_title: Eye catching colors, good for cold winters
links_reviews_text: I chose the sweater because I loved its colors and was happy with the way it looked in person! Fits true to size, though fabric is thick which makes the neck a bit tight. The main con is that the sweater can be itchy -- I wore with a crew neck undershirt once and a second time with a turtleneck underneath, which got hot fast!

The only reason I didn't give this adorable sweater 5 stars is because it was itchy. I'm super sensitive to itchy material though, and I didn't even think to look at the materials before renting. Ordered the XS but should've just gotten S, it runs true to size. Besides that, loved it!
Super warm & cozy on a sail! I wore this several times before returning and loved it.

links_reviews_title: Brighten up winter with this sweater
links_reviews_text: I put this sweater as true to size, it's definitely not oversized but it is kind of short. I wore this with the Colovos high waisted jeans, pointed toe stiletto boots, a Kate Spade tote and purple dangly earrings. Love it but won't buy it.
